page.title: 19Recollections
page.content: Recollections of a retired person. As a boy, I lived in Pontlottyn with my family.My father had a shop, but became a commercial traveller selling paraffin lamps. He cycled as far as Pembrokeshire selling them.Electricity came, and he worked for a paper bag firm.He supplied women with paper and glue and paid them 1 s for 1000 bags. During the 1926 Strike I collected coal from the tips with my brothers and sisters.I would carry the first bag half-way home and leave my sister to mind it while I went back for the next.My mother said that this walk back was my "spell".It took me 4hrs to get the coal home. Once I saved 3d and walked to see Merthyr play football.I spent 1d to get in,1d on tram fare to Dowlais and 1d on chips before walking 4 miles home.I later became a school- teacher and later still Headmaster.
